intro: Gonocalyx portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks. It has simple, alternate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Gonocalyx portoricensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for various small organisms.
